intro: Acer opalus, commonly known as the maple-leaved maple, is a deciduous tree native to central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged samaras as its fruit. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and urban landscapes.
